TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Velenje .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG ( ORG ) ( “ the ORG ” ) to grant him a pension on account of his reduced earning capacity ( PERSON wegen verminderter PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed his request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's administrative appeal lodged on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG made its submissions . However , it sent the required medical records only on DATE .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE no progress was made in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the applicant had applied to ORG for an early old age pension for disabled persons ( GPE für GPE ) ; this was refused on DATE . Subsequently , the applicant lodged an administrative appeal against this decision . ORG decided to await the outcome of the administrative appeal proceedings , as the administrative authority likewise had to examine the applicant 's potential occupational invalidity . On DATE his administrative appeal was dismissed . These proceedings were the object of application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( see “ II . Proceedings before the ORG ” below ) .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG resumed the proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG commissioned an expert report on the applicant 's earning capacity . On DATE the expert gave his report .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after holding an oral hearing , ORG dismissed the applicant 's action , as it could not be established that his earning capacity had been reduced at the time when he had made the required number of contributions to the statutory pension insurance ( gesetzliche GPE ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment was served on the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG . In his appeal he informed the court for the first time that he had previously applied for a pension from the NORP pension authorities . On DATE the court received the appeal and requested ORG to submit its observations . On DATE the ORG requested information from the NORP pension authorities in respect of the applicant 's former pension requests .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG received the information from the NORP authorities . However , they were translated only on DATE and submitted to the court on DATE . On DATE the ORG requested additional information from the NORP pension authorities which it received on DATE . On DATE it translated them and submitted the information to the court on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG sent the applicant 's file to ORG for an examination of the question whether the criteria for the requested pension had been met on the basis of the information given by the NORP pension authorities .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG replied that the requirements for the requested pension had not been fulfilled .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the applicant to indicate who his employers in GPE had been and what work he had done there .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court received the requested information after sending the applicant CARDINAL reminders , in DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court requested ORG to make its submissions on the information given by the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted its comments .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered an orthopaedic expert report . On CARDINAL DATE it commissioned the expert report , which the court received on DATE . On DATE the court requested ORG to make its comments on the report .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG to transmit the case files , which the court did on DATE . On CARDINAL DATE ORG submitted its comments .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG forwarded these comments to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE , after holding an oral hearing , ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal , mainly endorsing the judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment was served on the applicant .

CARDINAL . The present case was initially registered under application no . CARDINAL . In his application form the applicant merely complained about the refusal of ORG to grant him an early pension for disabled persons and a pension on account of his reduced earning capacity .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted that it had been incomprehensible for him why it took ORG and ORG such a long time to decide his application . In his view there had been too many delays in the whole case . Due to these delays he had now been suffering for DATE from a financial distress . He further maintained that he had been “ cheated ” for DATE by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to sever the proceedings in so far as they concerned the proceedings regarding a pension on account of the applicant 's reduced earning capacity and to conduct them under the instant application no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . By letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed the court that his proceedings concerning the pension on account of his reduced earning capacity were still pending and that he was very impatient because he “ has now been fighting for his rights for DATE ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG declared application no . CARDINAL concerning the disability pension inadmissible for being manifestly illfounded .
